page.title: 19MOBBERLEY'S CLAY INDUSTRY
page.content: Off Hall Lane is situated one of Mobberley's small industries, the domed-topped furnaces of the Bradley family business. Three generations of the Bradley family have been involved. Grandfather and father of Mr. Clifford Bradley made bricks at the larger brickworks in Small Lane, until the clay came to an end in the 1930's. Now the business in Hall Lane produces plant pots and drain pipes. The potter's wheel is being superseded by machinery for he can only turn out 1500 pots per day as against 6000 by machine. Clay plant pots and drain pipes are sent to all parts of the country and are remaining popular with traditional gardeners who prefer clay pots to plastic ones.
